docs.snippet: There was a new presence in the streets of Dili today: hard, no-nonsense men with berets, flowing hair and tiny two-way radios, the victors in a 24-year war of independence for East Timor.    Visiting from their mountain strongholds for a first-hand...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was a new presence in the streets of Dili today: hard, no-nonsense men with berets, flowing hair and tiny two-way radios, the victors in a 24-year war of independence for East Timor. Visiting from their mountain strongholds for a first-hand look at the capital, they were the first elements of the pro-independence guerrilla army known as Falintil to make a public showing here.
docs.abstract: First elements of pro-independence guerrilla army known as Falintil arrive in Dili, East Timor; meet with soldiers from international peacekeeping force whose presence has made rebels emergence from mountains possible; guerrilla leader Cornelio Gama photo (M)

headline.main: The New Hard Men in Timor's Capital: Freedom Fighters

docs.snippet: ''You're going to get hammered,'' said an elderly Irish gentleman standing outside Lansdowne Road stadium with a ticket in his hand and an impish look on his weathered face. ''You know that, don't you?''    If the subject had been football, or...
docs.lead_paragraph: ''You're going to get hammered,'' said an elderly Irish gentleman standing outside Lansdowne Road stadium with a ticket in his hand and an impish look on his weathered face. ''You know that, don't you?'' If the subject had been football, or basketball, or even the once exotic sport of soccer, it would have been difficult for an American visitor to agree with this confident Dubliner. But this was a rugby match the Americans were about to play against the Irish: a World Cup rugby match, to be precise, which made it all the more meaningful to the home team and all the more potentially painful for a team whose country does not often get to play the role of underdog internationally.

headline.main: World Cup Under Way In Europe

docs.snippet: D.C. United is making a bid to regain the title it lost last year to the Chicago Fire. After a 2-0 victory over Miami on Saturday in Game 1 of their Eastern Conference playoff series, United proved again that it would be the strongest challenger for...
docs.lead_paragraph: D.C. United is making a bid to regain the title it lost last year to the Chicago Fire. After a 2-0 victory over Miami on Saturday in Game 1 of their Eastern Conference playoff series, United proved again that it would be the strongest challenger for the title. Jaime Moreno scored both goals to put United a victory away from reaching the conference finals. D.C. United, which has captured two of the league's first three championships, is in the process of being sold for $25 million to $30 million, league officials said, in a deal that could be completed within two weeks.
docs.abstract: DC United, which has captured two of Major League Soccer's first three championships, is making bid to regain title it lost last year to Chicago Fire (S)

docs.snippet: Vice President Al Gore and former Senator Bill Bradley have a lot more in common than either would like to admit to Presidential primary voters.     Each will try to emphasize differences that matter to those voters when they debate for the first...
docs.lead_paragraph: Vice President Al Gore and former Senator Bill Bradley have a lot more in common than either would like to admit to Presidential primary voters. Each will try to emphasize differences that matter to those voters when they debate for the first time in New Hampshire on Wednesday night. But in fact, the two Democrats have spent the bulk of their public service careers as generally liberal members of Congress, with a quite similar approach to the job.
docs.abstract: Vice Pres Al Gore and former Senator Bill Bradley have lot more in common than either would like to admit to Presidential primary voters; each will try to emphasize differences that matter to voters when they debate for first time in New Hampshire on October 27; both have spent bulk of public service careers as generally liberal members of Congress, with quite similar approach to job; their similarities and differences discussed; photos (M)

headline.main: For Gore and Bradley, A Search for Distinction

docs.snippet: After a calamitous season as the worst team in Major League Soccer, the MetroStars and Bora Milutinovic agreed to part ways yesterday, leaving the team with the task of hiring its sixth coach since it started play in 1996.    Fernando Clavijo, an...
docs.lead_paragraph: After a calamitous season as the worst team in Major League Soccer, the MetroStars and Bora Milutinovic agreed to part ways yesterday, leaving the team with the task of hiring its sixth coach since it started play in 1996. Fernando Clavijo, an assistant coach and a friend of Milutinovic, has been named the interim coach and will be considered for the head coaching job, according to Charlie Stillitano, the MetroStars' vice president and general manager. Clavijo said yesterday he had also been interviewed by New England for the head coaching job with the Revolution.
docs.abstract: Bora Milutinovic is stepping down as coach of MetroStars; photo (M)

docs.snippet: Linda LaMar Carrubba and Andres Ignacio Rodriguez Ferrari were married on Friday at their home in Somerville, Mass. Jennifer E. Innis, a minister in training at the First and Second Unitarian Universalist Church of Boston, performed the ceremony.    ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Linda LaMar Carrubba and Andres Ignacio Rodriguez Ferrari were married on Friday at their home in Somerville, Mass. Jennifer E. Innis, a minister in training at the First and Second Unitarian Universalist Church of Boston, performed the ceremony. Ms. Carrubba, 35, is keeping her name. She is an executive assistant to the managing director of North American management consulting at Arthur D. Little Inc. in Cambridge, Mass. She graduated from Johns Hopkins University and received a master's degree in government from Harvard University. She is the daughter of Barbara and James G. Carrubba. The bride's father retired as a manager of administrative services at Columbia University in Manhattan. Her mother is the programming manager in administrative computing and information services at Kingsborough Community College in Brooklyn.

docs.lead_paragraph: TWO months before 1999 ends and computers get their real test of whether they know that time marches onward (and not back 100 years), the Y2K preparedness of air transportation systems worldwide falls into two categories: ''ready'' and ''unknown.'' A Department of Transportation Web site on Y2K, www.y2ktransport.dot.gov, captures the state of ambiguity:
docs.abstract: Matthew L Wald Correspondent's Report column on ambiguity on US Transportation Department's Web site over whether Y2K bug might cause isolated service disruptions, delays or diversions while traveling by air in US or abroad (M)

headline.main: Y2K Travel: Still Questions in the Air

docs.snippet: Tabare Vazquez, leader of the opposition left-wing Progressive Broad Front coalition, won the first round of presidential voting in Uruguay today, according to exit polls.    If borne out by official results, Mr. Vazquez, 59, a medical doctor, will...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tabare Vazquez, leader of the opposition left-wing Progressive Broad Front coalition, won the first round of presidential voting in Uruguay today, according to exit polls. If borne out by official results, Mr. Vazquez, 59, a medical doctor, will face Senator Jorge Batlle, 73, of the governing Colorado Party, who placed second according to the exit polls, in the runoff set for Nov. 28.
docs.abstract: Exit polls suggest Tabare Vazquez, leader of opposition left-wing Progressive Broad Front coalition, wins first round of presidential voting in Uruguay (S)

headline.main: Leftist Is Ahead in Uruguay's Election

docs.snippet: Greg Moore was killed yesterday in the season-ending CART race when he lost control of his car at 220 miles an hour and crashed into a wall, spinning wildly and slamming into the ground several times.     The 24-year-old Canadian was airlifted to a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Greg Moore was killed yesterday in the season-ending CART race when he lost control of his car at 220 miles an hour and crashed into a wall, spinning wildly and slamming into the ground several times. The 24-year-old Canadian was airlifted to a hospital and declared dead of massive head injuries about an hour after the wreck at California Speedway in Fontana, Calif.
docs.abstract: Greg Moore is killed in accident during Marlboro 500 auto race; Adrian Fernandez wins race (M)

docs.snippet: ASIA    CHINA: PROTESTS FALL OFF -- With the police patrolling Tiananmen Square in ever larger numbers, fewer members of the banned Falun Gong spiritual movement tried to protest, and witnesses reported seeing only a handful detained. Fugitive group...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASIA CHINA: PROTESTS FALL OFF -- With the police patrolling Tiananmen Square in ever larger numbers, fewer members of the banned Falun Gong spiritual movement tried to protest, and witnesses reported seeing only a handful detained. Fugitive group members vowed to carry on their campaign to reverse the condemnation, but the government restated its intent to root out and imprison leaders of what it called a ''malignant tumor'' in society. Erik Eckholm (NYT) CHINA: ACTIVIST ON TRIAL -- A prominent democracy advocate had a two-hour trial in Beijing on charges of conspiracy to subvert the government. His sentence was not announced but a guilty verdict is certain for Jiang Qisheng, who was previously jailed for two years after 1989, when he was a key student leader, and has since made public calls for democracy and commemorations for those killed in the June 1989 crackdown. Erik Eckholm (NYT)
